intro: Casselia integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf casselia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its simple, entire leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, round capsule that contains several seeds. Casselia integrifolia is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
